title: Script Foundation & Imports
description:
## Task
Create the base script file with proper imports, constants, and global state structure.

## Test Steps
1. Load script in TazUO - verify no import errors
2. Run script - verify main loop starts without crashes
3. Press ESC to stop - verify clean exit  
4. Check no error messages in system log

## Execution
Execute this task directly. When complete:
1. Add summary comment: bd comments add <your-id> [summary] <what was done>
2. Close the bead: bd close <your-id>

## Capturing Gaps/Learnings
Use bd comments add as needed
close_reason: Created Tamer_PetFarmer.py base script with proper imports, constants, state machine structure, and main loop. Includes persistence system, global state tracking, and placeholder functions for GUI/combat/healing. Script compiles without errors and follows CLAUDE.md patterns (non-blocking state machine, ProcessCallbacks first, short pauses).

title: Multi-Factor Danger Assessment System
description:
## Task
Implement the core danger calculation system that continuously evaluates threat level based on player HP, pet HP, enemy count, nearby NPCs, damage rate, and pet positioning. Returns 0-100 danger score with configurable weights.

## Test Steps
1. Initialize DangerAssessment with default weights
2. Call calculate_danger() with full HP, no enemies - verify returns 0-10 (safe)
3. Reduce player HP to 30% - verify danger rises to 30-50 range
4. Add 3 nearby hostile NPCs - verify danger rises further
5. Verify get_danger_zone() returns correct zone names
6. Adjust weights via configure_weights() - verify danger recalculates correctly

## Execution
Execute this task directly. When complete:
1. Add summary: bd comments add <your-id> [summary] done
2. Close: bd close <your-id>

comments.author: crameep
comments.text:
Implemented multi-factor danger assessment system in Tamer_PetFarmer.py.

Features:
- DangerAssessment class with 6 configurable weighted factors:
  * Player HP (30% weight) - inverse relationship, critical threshold at 30% HP
  * Pet HP (20% weight) - average across pets with tank weighting and critical threshold
  * Enemy count (20% weight) - linear scale up to 5 enemies
  * Nearby NPCs (10% weight) - diminishing returns for multiple NPCs
  * Damage rate (10% weight) - tracks HP samples over 10s window
  * Pet distance (10% weight) - spread and max distance from player

- Returns 0-100 danger score with zone mapping (SAFE/LOW/MODERATE/HIGH/CRITICAL)
- Configurable weights via configure_weights() with automatic normalization
- Helper methods: should_flee(), get_danger_zone(), reset()
- Integrated into main script initialization

Testing:
- Created comprehensive test suite (_support/test_danger_assessment.py)
- All 6 test scenarios pass:
  ✓ Initialization with normalized weights
  ✓ Full HP/no enemies = 0-10 danger (SAFE)
  ✓ 30% HP = 40 danger (MODERATE, in 30-50 range)
  ✓ Adding 3 NPCs raises danger appropriately
  ✓ Danger zone names map correctly
  ✓ Weight adjustment recalculates danger correctly

Implementation follows CLAUDE.md patterns:
- Null safety checks throughout
- Non-blocking design (no long pauses)
- String concatenation with str() conversion
- Error handling with fallback values
